snippet: Meeting the requirement set by Mayor Bill de Blasio for New York public schools will present major challenges, mostly in training enough teachers.
abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio plans to announce city's public schools will be required to offer computer science classes to all students within 10 years; effort faces several challenges, including lack of state teacher certification for subject.

byline.original: By KATE TAYLOR and CLAIRE CAIN MILLER

lead_paragraph: Meeting the requirement set by Mayor Bill de Blasio for New York public schools will present major challenges, mostly in training enough teachers.

headline.main: De Blasio to Announce 10-Year Deadline to Offer Computer Science to All Students
headline.print_headline: Mayor to Put Schools’ Focus on the Science of Computers
